sentences.sContent: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.sCn: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.sContent: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
...there are simple steps we can take to keep them at bay...
...and there are so many other factors affecting wealth—such as the oil deposits—that teasing out a simple economy-environment relationship would be almost impossible...
...The power of such simple psychology in fighting climate change is attracting attention across the political establishment...
...But exceptional companies approach these tradeoffs with two simple rules in mind...
...The reason for their actions is a simple yet powerful realisation that the environmental and economic footprints fit well together...
...our index backs up a simple but profound statement made by Hillary Clinton at the recent Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit...

...no one can deny the fact that the new information age has brought us so much convenience that we are allowed to get plenty of information just with a simple click sitting in front of the computers...
...Many people died as a result of the simple misunderstanding...
...Twitter's huge success is rooted in the simple but profound insight that in a medium with infinite space for self-expression...

synos.tran: 笨蛋；愚蠢的行为；出身低微者

过半数；一般多数， 简单多数

words.tran: 简单地；仅仅；简直；朴素地；坦白地

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved
